Package io.github.hexagonnico.vecmat.matrix

Class DoubleMatrix

java.lang.Object
io.github.hexagonnico.vecmat.matrix.DoubleMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixDoubleOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>, MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
public class DoubleMatrix extends Object implements MatrixDoubleOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
Class that represents an NxM double matrix.
Author:
Nico

    • DoubleMatrix

      public DoubleMatrix(double[][] values)
      Creates a matrix with the values in the given array.
      Parameters:
      values - Values in the matrix.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - if the given array is null or has length 0 or if any of the rows is null or if not all the rows have the same length.

  • Method Details

    • zero

      public static DoubleMatrix zero(int rows, int columns)
      Creates an NxM matrix where every element is 0.0
      Parameters:
      rows - Number of rows.
      columns - Number of columns.
      Returns:
      An NxM matrix where every element is 0.0
      Throws:
      NegativeArraySizeException - if the given number of rows or columns is smaller than zero.
      MatrixMathException - if the given number of rows or columns is zero.

    • identity

      public static DoubleMatrix identity(int size)
      Creates a square matrix where every element on the diagonal is 1.0 and all the other elements are 0.0
      Parameters:
      size - Size of the matrix.
      Returns:
      An identity matrix of the given size.
      Throws:
      MatrixMathException - if the given size is not greater than zero.

      public double element(int row, int column)
      Gets an element of this matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - Row of the element to get.
      column - Column of the element to get.
      Returns:
      The element at the given row and column.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given row or column is less than 0 or greater than the matrix's size.

    • plus

      public DoubleMatrix plus(DoubleMatrix matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the sum of this matrix with the given one.

      The sum of two matrices m1 and m2 of the same dimensions is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the sum of the element m-ij of m1 and the element m-ij of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      plus in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the sum, a matrix of the same type as this one.
      Returns:
      The sum of this matrix and the given one.

    • negative

      public DoubleMatrix negative()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the additive inverse of this matrix.

      The additive inverse of a matrix m is a matrix -m such that m + (-m) is a matrix where every element m-ij is 0.

      Specified by:
      negative in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Returns:
      The additive inverse of this matrix.

    • minus

      public DoubleMatrix minus(DoubleMatrix matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the subtraction of the given matrix from this one.

      The subtraction of a matrix m2 from a matrix m1 is defined as the sum of m1 with the additive inverse of m2. That is m1 - m2 = m1 + (-m2)

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      minus in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the subtraction, a matrix of the same type as this one.
      Returns:
      The subtraction of this matrix and the given one.

    • multipliedBy

      public DoubleMatrix multipliedBy(double k)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixDoubleOperations
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar.

      The product of a matrix m and a scalar k is a matrix m' such that every element m'-ij is the product of the element m-ij and k.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      multipliedBy in interface MatrixDoubleOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      k - The scalar to which this matrix is multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given scalar.

      Throws:

    • multiply

      public DoubleVector multiply(DoubleVector vector)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the product between this matrix and the given vector.

      The product between a matrix and a vector is the linear combination between all the columns of the matrix and all the elements of the vector.

      The product can also be defined as a vector where every element is the dot product of the corresponding row of the matrix and the vector.

      A vector and a matrix can only be multiplied if the matrix has the same number of columns as the vector has elements.

      Specified by:
      multiply in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      vector - The second operand of the product, a vector whose size is the same as the number of columns of this matrix.
      Returns:
      The result of the product between this matrix and the given vector.

    • transposed

      public DoubleMatrix transposed()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the transposed of this matrix.

      A transposed matrix is a matrix where every row i is the column i of the first matrix and every column j is the row j of the first matrix.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      transposed in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Returns:
      The transposed of this matrix.

    • negativeTransposed

      public DoubleMatrix negativeTransposed()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the negative transposed of this matrix.

      A transposed matrix is a matrix where every row i is the column i of the first matrix and every column j is the row j of the first matrix.

      The additive inverse of a matrix m is a matrix -m such that m + (-m) is a matrix where every element m-ij is 0.

      Specified by:
      negativeTransposed in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Returns:
      The negative transposed of this matrix.

    • multiply

      public DoubleMatrix multiply(DoubleMatrix matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Multiplies this matrix by the given one.

      Two matrices can only be multiplied if the first one has the same number of rows as the second one has columns.

      The product between two matrices m1 and m2 is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the dot product of the i-th row of m1 and the j-th column of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      multiply in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the product
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given one.

    • power

      public DoubleMatrix power(int exponent)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the power of this matrix.

      The n-th power of a matrix is the product of itself n times.

      Only square matrices can be raised to a power.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      power in interface MatrixOperations<DoubleMatrix,DoubleVector>
      Parameters:
      exponent - Exponent of the power.
      Returns:
      The n-th power of this matrix.
